intro: Galium rebae, commonly known as redstem wood-sorrel, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium rebae is often found in association with other woodland plants and is an important component of understory vegetation.
